edu.mines.jtk.util

Interface RTree.Boxer

  • Enclosing class:
    RTree

    public static interface RTree.Boxer
    Gets bounds and computes distances for objects added to an R-tree. An R-tree constructed with a boxer uses this interface to get the bounds of and distances to all objects added to the tree, even if those objects are RTree.Boxed.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void getBounds(java.lang.Object object, float[] min, float[] max)
      Gets the min/max coordinates for the specified object.
      float getDistanceSquared(java.lang.Object object, float[] point)
      Gets the distance squared from the specified object to a point.

    • Method Detail

      • getBounds

        void getBounds(java.lang.Object object,
             float[] min,
             float[] max)
        Gets the min/max coordinates for the specified object. While the object is in an R-tree, its bounds should be constant.
        Parameters:
        object - the object for which to compute bounds.
        min - array to contain min coordinates.
        max - array to contain max coordinates.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if this boxer cannot get bounds for the type of object specified.

      • getDistanceSquared

        float getDistanceSquared(java.lang.Object object,
                       float[] point)
        Gets the distance squared from the specified object to a point.
        Parameters:
        object - the object for which to compute distance squared.
        point - array of N point coordinates.
        Returns:
        the distance squared.
